intro: Hexalobus huillensis, commonly known as the Huillén mountain hibiscus, is a flowering plant native to the Andean regions of South America. It belongs to the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton plants. The plant is characterized by its showy, pentagonal-shaped flowers that range in color from white to pink. Its leaves are typically large, heart-shaped, and have a rough texture. Hexalobus huillensis is often found in high-altitude environments, thriving in cool, moist climates with well-drained soil.
